snippet: Since 2009, while Nelson L. Castro represented the West Bronx in the State Legislature, he was secretly recording and informing on his colleagues to prosecutors.
abstract: Nelson L Castro secretly recorded and informed on his colleagues in New York State Assembly to federal prosecutors since 2009, all the while representing the West Bronx in the Legislature; cooperation of Castro, who resigned under deal to avoid prosecution himself, led to bribery charges against Assemblyman Eric A Stevenson, fellow Democrat whose district adjoins that of Castro, as well as four other men.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Michael M. Grynbaum, Winnie Hu, William K. Rashbaum and Vivian Yee.

lead_paragraph: Since 2009, while Nelson L. Castro represented the West Bronx in the State Legislature, he was secretly recording and informing on his colleagues to prosecutors.

headline.seo: Assemblyman and Informer, Nelson L. Castro Led Double Life
headline.main: Albany Riveted by Double Life of an Assemblyman and Informer
headline.print_headline: Albany Riveted by Double Life Of an Assemblyman and Informer
